qas.question: What type of music did critics associate with corrupt high culture?
Which type of music seemed superficial and decadent?
What was another name used for the corrupted high culture of the indigenous people?
What type of music did critics associate with respected high culture?
Which type of music is always superficial and decadent?
When was there no differentiation between higher and lower culture?
What was another name used for the corrupted high culture of the foreign people?

context: Other <b5_0>19th-century<b5_0/> critics, following Rousseau have accepted this differentiation between higher and lower culture, but have seen the refinement and sophistication of high culture as corrupting and unnatural developments that obscure and distort people's essential nature. These critics considered <a0_0><b3_0>folk music<b3_0/><a0_0/> (as produced by "the folk", i.e., rural, illiterate, peasants) to honestly express a natural way of life, while <a1_0><b4_0>classical<b4_0/> music<a1_0/> seemed superficial and decadent. Equally, this view often portrayed indigenous peoples as "<a2_0><b6_0>noble savages<b6_0/><a2_0/>" living authentic and unblemished lives, uncomplicated and uncorrupted by the highly stratified capitalist systems of the West.
